Object.Field:
Author: Sunopsis Version: 4.2 Last Update: SEP 2006
Description: - Loading Knowledge Module - Loads data from any ISO-92 database to any ISO-92 compliant target database. - This module uses Sunopsis Agent to read selected data from the database and write the result into the target temporary table created dynamically. - When using this module on a journalized source table, the Journaling table is first updated to flag the records consumed and then cleaned from these records at the end of the interface.
Restrictions: - This Knowledge Module is NOT RECOMMENDED when using LARGE VOLUMES. Other specific modules using Bulk utilities (SQL*LOADER, BULK INSERT...) or direct links (DBLINKS, Linked Servers...) are usually more efficient.
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import time import string class Log: """Creates a log file and traces information """ def __init__(self, logfilename, uselog=1, append=0, printtoscreen=0): self.logfilename = logfilename self.printtoscreen = printtoscreen self.uselog=uselog if self.uselog: if not append: # Reset the file f = open(logfilename, "w") f.close()
def record(self, rec): if self.uselog: t = time.localtime() l = '%d-%02d-%02d %02d:%02d:%02d - %s' % (t[0], t[1], t[2], t[3], t[4], t[5], rec) f = open(self.logfilename, "a+") print >> f, l f.close() if self.printtoscreen: print l
logFilename='<%=snpRef.getOption("LOG_FILENAME")%>' useLog= <%=snpRef.getOption("Use Log")%> logger = Log(logfilename=logFilename, uselog=useLog, printtoscreen=1)

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang
driver, url, user, passwd = ( '<%=snpRef.getInfo( "DEST_JAVA_DRIVER" )%>', '<%=snpRef.getInfo( "DEST_JAVA_URL" )%>', '<%=snpRef.getInfo( "DEST_USER_NAME" )%>', '<%=snpRef.getInfo( "DEST_PASS" )%>')
##### Register Driver lang.Class.forName(driver) ##### Create a Connection Object myCon = sql.DriverManager.getConnection(url, user, passwd)
# Create SQL statement sqlcmd = "insert into <%=snpRef.getTable( "L" , "COLL_NAME" , "A" )%>(<%=snpRef.getColList( "" , "[CX_COL_NAME]" , "," , "" , "" )%>) values ( <%=snpRef.getColList( "" , " ? " , "," , "" , "" )%>)"
prepStmt = myCon.prepareStatement(sqlcmd)
# Open source file fsrc = open('<%=snpRef.getOption( "TEMP_DIR" )%>\C_<%=snpRef.getTargetTable( "RES_NAME" )%>.txt', 'r')
list_typelist="<%=snpRef.getColList( "" , "[SOURCE_DT]" , "," , "" , "" )%>,|||".split(',') list_colonnes="<%=snpRef.getColList( "" , "[CX_COL_NAME]" , "," , "" , "" )%>,|||".split(',')
try: # for each line of the source file for lsrc in fsrc.readlines(): # get the list of values separated by '\t' valuelist = lsrc.split('\t') i=0 while (list_typelist[i]<>'|||'): logger.record(str(i)+' Valeur:'+valuelist[i].strip().lstrip()) logger.record(str(i)+' Type:'+list_typelist[i].rstrip().lstrip()) logger.record(str(i)+' Colonne:'+list_colonnes[i].rstrip().lstrip()) if (list_typelist[i]=="CHAR"): prepStmt.setString(i+1, valuelist[i].rstrip().lstrip()) else: prepStmt.setDouble(i+1, float(valuelist[i].rstrip().lstrip())) i+=1 prepStmt.executeUpdate() finally: prepStmt.close() fsrc.close()
